snippet: VERDY--Violette. The entire New York City Ballet family mourns the passing of Violette Verdy, our dear friend and colleague, and one of the great ballerinas of the 20th century. Born in France, where she began an acclaimed international career, Violette danced with New York City Ballet from 1958 until 1977. During that time her unique gifts inspired both George Balanchine and Jerome Robbins to create roles for her in such masterpieces as "Emeralds," "Liebeslieder Walzer," "Tschaikovsky Pas de Deux," and "Dances at a Gathering." Also a renowned teacher, Violette has touched the lives of countless young dancers with her knowledge, charm, grace, and joie de vivre. She will be greatly missed. 1/3
